Xor-sequence

Problem
Code
A kind of construction problem. At first, figure out the pattern which is a repeating sequence: 0,1,2,2,6,7,0,0. And then calculate the result based on the given position.

entry.title: Debug Java Program in Eclipse Tutorial
Hackerrank Data Structure Problem Solution List IV
entry.content:
Here is the summary of Hackerrank data structure problem solution list.
summary list

Below is the detailed explanation of the idea behind solution.

Merging communities

Problem Link
Code Link
Data structure problem. Use union find data structure to simulate the process.

Components in a graph

Problem Link
Code Link
DFS problem. Just use DFS to count the number of nodes of the connected components.

Data Structures MCQ 1

Problem Link
Answer: n - 1

Data Structures MCQ 2

Problem Link
Answer: segment tree

Data Structures MCQ 3

Problem Link
Answer: Stack

Contact

Problem Link
Code Link
Data structure and DP problem. Use DP with Trie as data structure. Pre-calculate the number of substrings of dictionary and dp[i] is the number of substrings that ends with ith node of Trie tree. So for any given string, if it can be found as a subtring of any strings on the dictionary, return the corresponding dp[i].

No Prefix Set

Problem Link
Code Link.
Data structure problem. Just use Trie tree to simulate the process.

entry.title: Redis QuickStart
entry.content:
Redis is an open source, in-memory data structure store fro database, cache and message broker. It supports data structures such as strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets with range queries and bitmaps, hyperloglogs and geospatial indexes with radius queries.
Here is the official website of redis.

Below is a simple quick start tutorial of redis. And here is the official tutorial.

Install Redis

We can go to official website to download the software. Or execute the command below:

Then move the tarball to the directory where we want to save the software and then extract it there.

Now go to redis-stable directory and build the software:

To build Redis, we need to install gcc and g++ on the machine.
After that, we can copy the following two executable files to proper places:

Or just execute:

At last, set these two executable files into PATH environment variable.

Run Redis Server

At first, let us see the five main executable files under src folder:

So to start Redis server, just run this command:

If the server starts successfully, we can see similar output in terminal as follows:

To shutdown the server, just press ‘ctrl + c’ and we will see this output:

Run Redis Client

To start Redis client, execute this command:

Here is a small test below:
entry.summary:
Redis is an open source, in-memory data structure store fro database, cache and message broker. It supports data structures such as strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets with range queries and bitmaps, hyperloglogs and geospatial indexes with radius queries.
Here is the official website of redis.

Below is a simple quick start tutorial of redis. And here is the official tutorial.

entry.title: MongoDB Quick Start on Mac
entry.content:
Here is the tutorial about how to install and run MonogoDB on mac. Below is the link of official document:
official document

Install MongoDB

There are multiple ways to install MOngoDB on Mac. Here we use Homebrew to install it.
At first, we should install Homebrew if we do not have one running on Mac. Execute this command:

To test whether it is installed successfully, run this command:

And output should be similar as follows:

If we have already installed one, update it through this command:

And then install MongoDB binaries using this command:

or build MongoDB from source with TLS/SSL support:

or install the latest development release of MongoDB through this command:

Init MongoDB

To init MongoDB, we should at first create a data directory for it:

/data/db is default data directory, but here I create a different data directory:

And then set permission for that directory, the most brute force approach is as follows (not recommended):

Run MongoDB

If the system PATH variable includes the location of mongod binary, and data directory is the default one, then use this command:

If the system PATH variable does not include the location of mongod binary, and data directory is the default one, use this command instead:

If the system PATH variable includes the location of mongod binary, and data directory is not the default one, then use this command:

So for me, the command is this one:

If MongoDB is running successfully, the output of terminal is similar as follows:

We can visit this URL: http://localhost:27017/ from the browser.
entry.summary:
Here is the tutorial about how to install and run MonogoDB on mac. Below is the link of official document:
official document

Hexo Theme

entry.title: Hexo Blog 简明教程 I
entry.content:
Hexo 是一个由台湾学生开发的，基于node.js的静态博客。这个博客拥有很好的模块设计，用户可以很方便地在博客上添加自己需要的或者是喜欢的元素，比如评论排行，日期等等；同时也可以很方便地做一些个性化的设置，比如更换博客主题等等。总之，Hexo有很多优点，是一个非常适合技术人员的博客。因此，接下来的几个教程都是有关于如何使用Hexo搭建自己的个性化博客。

这些教程有中文和英文版本。这里先提供中文版。下面这个链接是我的博客的github代码库，供大家参考：
Github Yular
注：这份教程可能更适合mac和linux/unix用户，windows用户可能在最初的环境配置上需要另外找别的教程。

安装npm和hexo

第一步是在电脑上安装npm和hexo。先安装好npm才能安装hexo。npm是和node.js相关联的javascript管理工具，所以安装好node.js后，npm就能够使用了。
这里是nodejs的官网，上面介绍了下载和安装方法：
nodejs official site.
或者是我的这个教程：
nodejs install

确认npm命令可以使用以后，运行下面这个命令安装hexo命令：

注：-g 不能省略掉。
用这个命令来确认hexo是否安装成功：

如果输出是类似这样的，就表示安装成功了：

博客初始化

在自己想要的地方，新建一个文件夹作为整个博客的项目文件夹，然后运行这个命令：

这时，一个完整的Hexo博客项目就会生成在当前文件夹下。

Hexo上新建博客，测试博客和部署博客到远端服务器（比如Github 服务器）等，一般都需要使用这些命令（只是常用命令）：

好了，接下来运行这两个命令：

默认情况下，访问这个地址，就可以看到部署在本地上的Hexo博客了：
http://localhost:4000

部署Hexo 到Github server

Github给每一个用户都提供了一个免费的，以.github.io结尾的域名，而Hexo博客不需要数据库，它的所有博客都是以文本的方式保存在本地，而相关统计数据，比如访问量等，可以由第三方API提供。因此我们可以将Hexo博客部署到Github上。这样做还有一个好处是方便代码的管理。

首先是安装GitHub，这里有很好的官方文档：
Setup Git
必须完成前两步，记得将SSH Key放到自己的Github账户上，不然没法完成部署。

新建一个repository，名字必须为 username.github.io。此处的username为我们Github账户的用户名。如果是帮助他人搭建和部署博客，记得让对方将自己加为coordinate developer。

接下来是安装Hexo插件，基本上是以下这些：

然后是修改Hexo项目文件夹下的_config.yml文件，在URL 和 Deployment 一项，改成如下：

将其中的内容对应的替换成自己的即可。最后运行这些命令将博客部署到Github上：

如果没有报错，大概等上一小段时间就可以在浏览器上访问到博客了，比如我的这个：
http://yular.github.io。

自定义域名和DNS服务器配置

由于我还没有购买域名和使用DNS服务器，因此有关这部分内容的教程暂时不写，又需要的朋友麻烦自行谷歌或百度吧或Bing吧~
entry.summary:
Hexo 是一个由台湾学生开发的，基于node.js的静态博客。这个博客拥有很好的模块设计，用户可以很方便地在博客上添加自己需要的或者是喜欢的元素，比如评论排行，日期等等；同时也可以很方便地做一些个性化的设置，比如更换博客主题等等。总之，Hexo有很多优点，是一个非常适合技术人员的博客。因此，接下来的几个教程都是有关于如何使用Hexo搭建自己的个性化博客。

这些教程有中文和英文版本。这里先提供中文版。下面这个链接是我的博客的github代码库，供大家参考：
Github Yular
注：这份教程可能更适合mac和linux/unix用户，windows用户可能在最初的环境配置上需要另外找别的教程。

entry.title: Maven Junit Test QuickStart
entry.content:
Unit test is very important in software engineering development. It can help developers to figure out which functions have bugs by test them independently. Currently there are many frameworks for this kind of test. Here we introduce one of the most popular frameworks called JUnit Test. For more information about JUnit, check this link.

Below is a quickstart tutorial for Java junit test using Maven. All the steps are done by command lines.

Create Maven Project

Execute the command below or check this tutorial to learn how to create a Maven project:

Note that we can change the value of -DgroupId, -DartifactId and -DarchetypeArtifactId parameters as we want.

Edit pom.xml file

Put the following content into pom.xml:

The reason why here I use maven-compile-plugin is that by default maven does not support annotation like “@test” in the source code; so we use additional plugin to change the default configuration of maven compiler to support that feature.

Edit App.java and Create Test class

An java file called App.java is generated by default and we can find it under this path, assuming that we are already in the project folder:

Then put the following code into App.java:

After that, we will create two test class under this path:

By default there has been a test class but here we do not need it. We will create the following two classes for test instead:

At last, edit AppAddTest.java file as follows:

and edit AppMinusTest.java file as well:

Obviously, there is an error in AppAddTest class because 5+6 == 11 not 10. Let us see what will happen if errors are found in the test.

Execute Junit Test

There are mainly two ways to do junit test.
The first way is to run all the junit tests together. But if there are errors found during test, the process will not stop until all the tests are done. So here is the command:

And the result should be or at least similar as follows:

Note that the default test class AppTest will also be executed.

The second way is to run each test independently. Here it is:

The result should be like this:

This time only AppAddTest is executed and of course it fails.
What about this one:

The result is here:

This time only AppMinusTest is executed and it pass the test.

Code Download

Everyone can check this simple project in my Github from this link.
entry.summary:
Unit test is very important in software engineering development. It can help developers to figure out which functions have bugs by test them independently. Currently there are many frameworks for this kind of test. Here we introduce one of the most popular frameworks called JUnit Test. For more information about JUnit, check this link.

Below is a quickstart tutorial for Java junit test using Maven. All the steps are done by command lines.

entry.title: bower command summary
entry.content:
Bower is a very useful and easy to use Web libraries management tool, which can manage components containing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, fonts or even image files. Bower uses a kind of manifest file called bower.json to keeps track of packages used in project. Below is the link of official website:
bower.io

Here is the method to install bower
Bower requires node, npm and git. After we have installed all these staffs, we can install bower through this command:

Note: please do not ignore -g parameter.

Here is the summary of frequent used bower commands:

bower init

Interactively create a bower.json file

bower install

The command syntax is as follows:

Installs project dependencies recursively, which inclue:

If –save flag is used in , all additional endpoints will be saved to dependencies in bower.json.
Endpoints have following forms:

Options include:

bower uninstall

The command syntax is as follows:

Uninstall a package from local bower_components directory.
The options include:

bower update

The command syntax is as follows:

Updates installed packages to their newest version according to bower.json.
The options include:

bower help

The command syntax is as follows:

Display help information about the given command.

bower info

Display overall information of a package or of a particular version.

bower list

The command syntax is as follows:

List packages and possible updates on the local.
The options include:

bower cache

The command syntax is as follows:

The list is as follows:

bower search

The command syntax is as follows:

Finds all packages or a specific package.

bower prune

Uninstalls local extraneous packages.

bower version

Get the version of bower.
entry.summary:
Bower is a very useful and easy to use Web libraries management tool, which can manage components containing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, fonts or even image files. Bower uses a kind of manifest file called bower.json to keeps track of packages used in project. Below is the link of official website:
bower.io

Here is the method to install bower
Bower requires node, npm and git. After we have installed all these staffs, we can install bower through this command:

Note: please do not ignore -g parameter.

entry.title: Web Dev Experience: Using Angular Material and Bootstrap Together
entry.content:
Here is the link about this question.

When we do web front-end development, we may find that some elements can be implemented more easily in Angular Material but others can be implemented in Angular Bootstrap more easily. However, it is a bad idea to use them together in the same Web application front-end.

The main reasons are as follows:

  1. Both their css target front end elements but they have different designs. For example, even though dialog of both libraries are rectangle, the dialog of bootstrap is round rectangle. So if use them together, the look and feel of elements may be inconsistent.

2.Angular material handles front end elements using directive. When they release a new version (29 releases so far), developers have to spent some time testing earlier code.

3.Increase the dependencies size of project.

entry.title: Bootstrap CSS Grid System Summary
entry.content:
Here is the definition of Bootstrap grid system from its official document:

Bootstrap grid system has a three levels structure for creating page layout and these levels are (from highest to lowest): container, row and column. We can put the content like form, button, panel and table into the columns so that all the page elements are put into the places as we want. Besides, column level can be nested through adding rows and then columns into it but we do not put container into rows or columns.

Here is the instruction about how to use Bootstrap grid system:

  1. Put one and only one (recommended) container on the page. Here is the example code:

2.Put one or more rows into the container above. Nested rows are not recommended. Here is the example code:

3.Put one or more columns into the row(s) above. Nested grid system is fine but should start from row level. Besides, we can use predefined grid classes to specifiy the number of twelve available columns we wish to span: for example, we can predefine three equal columns through three .col-xs-4. Here is the example code:

Note that we can use padding attribute to create gutters (gaps between column content). It is offset in rows for the first and the last column via negative margin on .rows.

4.Put content elements inside columns. Here is the example code:

Below is the official Bootstrap grid examples
Bootstrap Grid Example

And for more details about grid system, check the link of the officail document below:
Bootstrap Grid System
entry.summary:
Here is the definition of Bootstrap grid system from its official document:

Bootstrap grid system has a three levels structure for creating page layout and these levels are (from highest to lowest): container, row and column. We can put the content like form, button, panel and table into the columns so that all the page elements are put into the places as we want. Besides, column level can be nested through adding rows and then columns into it but we do not put container into rows or columns.

Here is the instruction about how to use Bootstrap grid system:
